eSWT API MIDlet

This example demonstrates the Implementation of Browser API of the eSWT.

Section Contents

1. Introduction

2. Use cases

3. Design Diagrams

4. User Interface

Introduction

Example MIDlet applications are generic applications which gives basic example of usablility of particular JSRs. Developers can use it for reference and testers can use it to test relevant JSR. MIDlet is intended for S60_5th_Edition_SDK.

eSWT Example MIDlet Applications is designed to run on S60_5th_Edition_SDK. It will be designed to as a developers take reference to create useful applications for particular eSWT API. It will be designed to let the testers to test particular API. This example application demonstrate the usage of Expanded-SWT and SWT-Mobile-Extension API’s.


 

Uses Cases

Open any valid WEB page

Functionality of the Example Midlet Application

1. org.eclipse.swt.browser.Browser

Open the Browser and open the URL

2. org.eclipse.ercp.swt.mobile.QueryDialog

Query dialouge box for the user to enter the URL

3. org.eclipse.swt.events.SelectionListener

Use of SelectionListener for the commands.

Design Diagrams

eSWT Reference Architecture

 

User Interface

When the midlet is Started,The user is prompted to enter the URL.

User can use the Virtual Keypad to enter the URL.

User is prompted to select a valid access point for the network access.

If the User entered URL is valid then the WEB-PAGE is opened in the browser..

If the User entered URL is not valid then the browser will throwe a exception.
